subject: Politics
title: Why Decentralize
description: A micro-lesson that makes Why Decentralize usable.

hook.text: Decisions made far from the people they affect tend to be worse. Distance breeds bad policy.

buildup.text: Decentralization pushes decision-making closer to citizens. Local leaders know local problems better.

discovery.text: Studies show decentralized governments respond faster and adapt better to community needs.

twist.text: But decentralization creates inequality. Rich regions thrive while poor ones fall further behind.

climax.text: The best systems decentralize decisions but equalize funding. Local control with national standards.

punchline.text: Centralize standards. Decentralize decisions. That's the formula.

quiz.question: What is a major risk of decentralization?
options: It can increase inequality between rich and poor regions
It always leads to national breakup
